org.jetel.graph

Class Edge

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jetel.graph.GraphElement
      • org.jetel.graph.Edge
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IGraphElement, InputPort, InputPortDirect, OutputPort, OutputPortDirect
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    JobflowEdge

    public class Edge
extends GraphElement
implements InputPort, OutputPort, InputPortDirect, OutputPortDirect
    A class that represents Edge Proxy - surrogate which directs calls to apropriate Edge implementation according to edge type specification
    Since:
    August 3, 2003
    See Also:
    DirectEdge, PhaseConnectionEdge, InputPort, OutputPort, EdgeFactory

      • isRemote

        public boolean isRemote()
        Returns:
        true if this edge is remote; either reader of this edge is RemoteEdgeDataTransmitter or writer of this edge is RemoteEdgeDataReceiver; getReaderRunId() differs from getWriterRunId()

      • getReaderRunId

        public long getReaderRunId()
        Returns:
        runId of reader component; RemoteEdgeComponent is considered as component which is running on different worker

      • getWriterRunId

        public long getWriterRunId()
        Returns:
        runId of writer component RemoteEdgeComponent is considered as component which is running on different worker

      • init

        public void init()
          throws ComponentNotReadyException
        This method creates appropriate version of Edge (direct or buffered) based on specified type and then initializes it.
        Specified by:

        Overrides:

        Since:
        April 2, 2002

      • preExecute

        public void preExecute()
                throws ComponentNotReadyException
        Description copied from interface: IGraphElement
        This is also initialization method, which is invoked before each separate graph run. That is, it can be invoked multiple times. Use IGraphElement.firstRun() to determine whether given invocation is the first one. Contrary to the IGraphElement.init() procedure, this method should allocate only resources for this single graph run. All resources allocated in this method should be released in the IGraphElement.postExecute() method.
        Specified by:
        preExecute in interface IGraphElement
        Overrides:
        preExecute in class GraphElement
        Throws:
        ComponentNotReadyException - some of the required resource is not available or other precondition is not accomplish

      • initDebugMode

        protected void initDebugMode()

      • postExecute

        public void postExecute()
                 throws ComponentNotReadyException
        Description copied from interface: IGraphElement
        This is de-initialization method for a single graph run. All resources allocated in IGraphElement.preExecute() method should be released here. It is guaranteed that this method is invoked after graph finish at the latest. For some graph elements, for instance components, is this method called immediately after phase finish.
        Specified by:
        postExecute in interface IGraphElement
        Overrides:
        postExecute in class GraphElement
        Throws:
        ComponentNotReadyException

                                java.lang.InterruptedException

        Specified by:

      • readRecordDirect

        @Deprecated
public boolean readRecordDirect(java.nio.ByteBuffer record)
                         throws java.io.IOException,
                                java.lang.InterruptedException
        Deprecated. use readRecordDirect(CloverBuffer)
        Description copied from interface: InputPortDirect
        An operation that reads one record from this port - in its serialized (binary form).
        The passed-in object (content) is cleared first (using ByteBuffer.clear()). When data is stored in it, ByteBuffer.flip() operation is called upon it - it is ready to be read when method call ends.
        Specified by:
        readRecordDirect in interface InputPortDirect
        Parameters:
        record - ByteBuffer into which data should be stored
        Returns:
        True if success, otherwise false (when no more data available)
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If reading failed during method call
        java.lang.InterruptedException - If thread waiting to be notified was interrupted

      • writeRecordDirect

        @Deprecated
public void writeRecordDirect(java.nio.ByteBuffer record)
                       throws java.io.IOException,
                              java.lang.InterruptedException
        Deprecated. use writeRecordDirect(CloverBuffer)
        Description copied from interface: OutputPortDirect
        An operation that passes/writes one record through this port.
        The passed-in object (ByteBuffer) must be ready to be read - i.e. ByteBuffer.position() should be 0 and ByteBuffer.limit() should be pointing to the end of data in the buffer.
        Specified by:
        writeRecordDirect in interface OutputPortDirect
        Parameters:
        record - ByteBuffer containing the data to be written/sent
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If writing failed during method call
        java.lang.InterruptedException - If thread waiting to be notified was interrupted

      • hasData

        public boolean hasData()
        Description copied from interface: InputPort
        Method which tests whether data (including EOF flag) is awaiting/ready to be read. Following read operation should not block, nonetheless can return null as EOF flag.
        Specified by:
        hasData in interface InputPort
        Returns:
        True if read operation won't block due to lack of data

      • checkConfig

        public ConfigurationStatus checkConfig(ConfigurationStatus status)
        Description copied from interface: IGraphElement
        Checks the configuration of this graph element. This method should verify that all required parameters are set and that the element can be used. This method might be called before graph execution, in such case it will be called before the IGraphElement.init() method. It is not guaranteed that this method will ever be called, but also this method may be called repeatedly. All resources allocated in this method should be freed in this method too.
        Specified by:
        checkConfig in interface IGraphElement
        Overrides:
        checkConfig in class GraphElement

      • free

        public void free()
        Description copied from interface: IGraphElement
        This is de-initialization method for this graph element. All resources allocated in IGraphElement.init() method should be released here. This method is invoked only once at the end of this graph element existence.
        Specified by:
        free in interface IGraphElement
        Overrides:
        free in class GraphElement

      • setEdge

        public void setEdge(EdgeBase edge)
        Sets specific EdgeBase instance which is used as real edge algorithm. By default, the EdgeBase instance is created in initialisation time based on EdgeTypeEnum. Edge type is automatically updated as well.
        Parameters:
        edge -

      • getEdge

        public Edge getEdge()
        Specified by:
        getEdge in interface InputPort
        Specified by:
        getEdge in interface OutputPort
        Returns:
        associated edge with this input port
        See Also:
        InputPort.getEdge(), OutputPort.getEdge()

      • getEdgeBase

        public EdgeBase getEdgeBase()
        Returns:
        true if this edge shares edge base with parent graph - see Subgraph component

      • setSharedEdgeBaseFromWriter

        public void setSharedEdgeBaseFromWriter(boolean sharedEdgeBaseFromWriter)
        The edge has got EdgeBase via setEdge(EdgeBase) and this edge is not owner of the given edge base, so some operations above EdgeBase are not performed in this edge. This sharing is caused by writer component
        Parameters:
        sharedEdgeBase -

      • setSharedEdgeBaseFromReader

        public void setSharedEdgeBaseFromReader(boolean sharedEdgeBaseFromReader)
        The edge has got EdgeBase via setEdge(EdgeBase) and this edge is not owner of the given edge base, so some operations above EdgeBase are not performed in this edge. This sharing is caused by reader component.
        Parameters:
        sharedEdgeBase -

      • isSharedEdgeBase

        public boolean isSharedEdgeBase()
        Input and output edges of SubgraphInput/Output components can share EdgeBase with parent graph. This is important to known, that the EdgeBase is shared. So EdgeBase initialisation, pre-execution, post-execution and freeing is not performed in this edge.

      • isSharedEdgeBaseFromWriter

        public boolean isSharedEdgeBaseFromWriter()
        Returns:
        true if this edge is shared and this sharing is caused by writer component

      • isSharedEdgeBaseFromReader

        public boolean isSharedEdgeBaseFromReader()
        Returns:
        true if this edge is shared and this sharing is caused by reader component

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class GraphElement
